CIGAR Visualization

Source: vignettes/cigar.Rmd
cigar.Rmd

Read in SAM files as tibble

toy <- read_sam(system.file("extdata", "toy.sam", package = "utilitarian"))

toy
#> # A tibble: 12 x 11
#>    QNAME  FLAG RNAME   POS  MAPQ CIGAR    RNEXT PNEXT  TLEN SEQ        QUAL     
#>    <chr> <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>    <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <chr>      <chr>    
#>  1 r001    163 ref       7    30 8M4I4M1~ =        37    39 TTAGATAAA~ *        
#>  2 r002      0 ref       9    30 1S2I6M1~ *         0     0 AAAAGATAA~ *        
#>  3 r003      0 ref       9    30 5H6M     *         0     0 AGCTAA     *        
#>  4 r004      0 ref      16    30 6M14N1I~ *         0     0 ATAGCTCTC~ *        
#>  5 r003     16 ref      29    30 6H5M     *         0     0 TAGGC      *        
#>  6 r001     83 ref      37    30 9M       =         7   -39 CAGCGCCAT  *        
#>  7 x1        0 ref2      1    30 20M      *         0     0 aggttttat~ ????????~
#>  8 x2        0 ref2      2    30 21M      *         0     0 ggttttata~ ????????~
#>  9 x3        0 ref2      6    30 9M4I13M  *         0     0 ttataaaac~ ????????~

#> 11 x5        0 ref2     12    30 24M      *         0     0 aaTaattaa~ ????????~
#> 12 x6        0 ref2     14    30 23M      *         0     0 Taattaagt~ ????????~

Create Tidy CIGAR Data

Results in a long table of tidy data showing start and end positions of the operations along with their English translations.

Due to the facetting of CIGAR visualizations on Reference names (RNAME) it is wise to group them together if the organism is what matters. For example in the case of the human genome vs sars coronavirus grouping all the human chromosomes together is useful.

sam %>% 
  mutate(RNAME = case_when(RNAME == "MN908947.3" ~ "hcov",
                           RNAME == "*" ~ "unmapped",
                           TRUE ~ "human")) %>% 
  tidy_cigar()
                           
toy.tc <- tidy_cigar(toy)

toy.tc
#> # A tibble: 31 x 7
#> # Groups:   QNAME, RNAME [10]
#>    QNAME RNAME  MAPQ CIGARstart CIGARend operation Operation
#>    <chr> <chr> <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>     <chr>    
#>  1 r001  ref      30          1        8 M         Match    
#>  2 r001  ref      30          8       12 I         Insertion
#>  3 r001  ref      30         12       16 M         Match    
#>  4 r001  ref      30         16       17 D         Deletion 
#>  5 r001  ref      30         17       20 M         Match    
#>  6 r001  ref      30         20       29 M         Match    
#>  7 r002  ref      30          1        1 S         Soft Clip
#>  8 r002  ref      30          1        3 I         Insertion
#>  9 r002  ref      30          3        9 M         Match    
#> 10 r002  ref      30          9       10 P         Padding  
#> # ... with 21 more rows

Plot a CIGAR

Plotting a cigar from a single read in the tidied cigar table is done using plot_cigar() and specifying the read. Plots are facetted based on the references. Returns a plot.

plot_cigar(toy.tc, "r002")

Plot all CIGARs

A wrapper around calling plot_cigar() on all the reads in the SAM file. Will warn and stop if more than 20 elements to be created, override this with the lg=TRUE argument.

p <- plot_all_cigars(toy.tc)

p[[1]]

p[[2]]
